timeline.bodyText: Remove this file from your commit.
timeline.author: corneliouzbett
ibacher

replies.bodyText: the one-liner would not throw a FhirException, and we would have the same behavior (null value) for an order a wrong type as a not-found UUID, correct?
replies.author: pmanko

replies.bodyText: also, what should guide the decision between using the Service class functionality vs. using Hibernate directly?
replies.author: pmanko

replies.bodyText:
Yes, it would not throw the FhirException, but that's ok because we're limiting things to TestOrders rather than the whole order table.
My thinking is that we should use the OpenMRS service layer as little as possible. This can get complicated though. For example, in the FhirPatientDaoImpl, we rely on the patientService because the logic there is hard to duplicate, especially in more recent versions of the platform which use Lucene for full text searching. Similarly, in the FhirConceptDaoImpl, I used the conceptService because the getConceptsByMapping() function is a bit convoluted and I wanted to make sure it was done correctly.
replies.author: ibacher
